definition: either this or that/one or the other
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
this/these
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
that/those/(one) another

sentences.english: Nationality need not be an either/or choice.
sentences.chinese: 移民的民族性不必非此即彼。

sentences.english: You should know that a deductive argument is an either-or thing.
sentences.chinese: 你应该知道演绎的论点是一个非此即彼的东西。

sentences.english: She rejects the idea that happiness has to be an either-or proposition.
sentences.chinese: 她不认为幸福是非此即彼的命题。

definition: black-or-white (e.g. good or bad, with no middle ground)
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
(Maoism) one divides into two
zero-sum game (economics)
paradox (logic)
mutually exclusive
determinism
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
dialectics/dialectic or Socratic method of debate
pluralism, philosophical doctrine that the universe consists of different substances
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
having no common measure/incommensurable/incommensurate
completely/sharply (differing)
markedly/clearly
tautology
